# ðŸ‘¤ Register New Account

**Endpoint:** `POST {{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register`  
**Format:** `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`

---

### ðŸ“¥ Request Body

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `username` | String | Unique login identifier. |
| `email` | String | User's email (for verification). |
| `password` | String | Secure account password. |
| `firstName` | String | User's first name. |
| `lastName` | String | User's last name. |

---

### ðŸ“¤ Success Response (200 OK)

\`\`\`json  
{  
"success": true,  
"message": "User registered successfully",  
"userId": "guid-id-string"  
}

### Usage Example

``` antlr4
POST {{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
username=johndoe&password=securepassword123&email=johndoe@example.com&firstName=John&lastName=Doe

 ```

This example demonstrates how to format the request to register a new user account.

## Register Account API

This endpoint allows users to register a new account in the system. By providing the necessary details, users can create their profiles and gain access to the platform's features.

### Request

**Method:** POST  
**Endpoint:** `{{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register`

#### Request Body

The request must be sent in `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` format and should include the following parameters:

- **username** (text): A unique identifier for the user. This will be used for login purposes.
    
- **password** (text): The password for the account. It should meet the security requirements set by the system.
    
- **email** (text): The email address associated with the account. This will be used for account verification and communication.
    
- **firstName** (text): The user's first name.
    
- **lastName** (text): The user's last name.
    

### Response

Upon successful registration, the API will respond with a JSON object containing the following fields:

- **success** (boolean): Indicates whether the registration was successful.
    
- **message** (string): A descriptive message about the registration status.
    
- **userId** (string): The unique identifier for the newly created user account.
    

### Important Notes

- Ensure that all required fields are provided in the request. Missing or invalid parameters may result in an error response.
    
- The username must be unique; if the username is already taken, the API will return an error.
    
- Consider implementing client-side validation to enhance user experience before making the API call.
    

### Usage Example

``` antlr4
POST {{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
username=johndoe&password=securepassword123&email=johndoe@example.com&firstName=John&lastName=Doe

 ```

This example demonstrates how to format the request to register a new user account.

## Register Account API

This endpoint allows users to register a new account in the system. By providing the necessary details, users can create their profiles and gain access to the platform's features.

### Request

**Method:** POST  
**Endpoint:** `{{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register`

#### Request Body

The request must be sent in `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` format and should include the following parameters:

- **username** (text): A unique identifier for the user. This will be used for login purposes.
    
- **password** (text): The password for the account. It should meet the security requirements set by the system.
    
- **email** (text): The email address associated with the account. This will be used for account verification and communication.
    
- **firstName** (text): The user's first name.
    
- **lastName** (text): The user's last name.
    

### Response

Upon successful registration, the API will respond with a JSON object containing the following fields:

- **success** (boolean): Indicates whether the registration was successful.
    
- **message** (string): A descriptive message about the registration status.
    
- **userId** (string): The unique identifier for the newly created user account.
    

### Important Notes

- Ensure that all required fields are provided in the request. Missing or invalid parameters may result in an error response.
    
- The username must be unique; if the username is already taken, the API will return an error.
    
- Consider implementing client-side validation to enhance user experience before making the API call.
    

### Usage Example

``` antlr4
POST {{base_url}}/api/Accounts/Register
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
username=johndoe&password=securepassword123&email=johndoe@example.com&firstName=John&lastName=Doe

 ```

item.description:
### User & Account Management

- **\[Anonymous Access\]:** Open for everyone to **Register** a new account, **Login** to receive a token, and perform **Password Resets**.
    
- **\[Auth Access\]:** Authenticated users can view their **Personal Profile**, update account details, and manage their address book.
    
- **\[Admin Access\]:** Admins have exclusive authority to view all users, manage roles, and perform account-level administrative actions.
    
- **Security:** Uses JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authentication to protect user data and restrict access to private endpoints.

item.name: Categories
item.description:
### Category Management

- **Public Access:** Browse and view all product categories.
    
- **Admin Access:** Full control to **Create**, **Update**, and **Delete** categories.
    
- **Organization:** Helps in structuring the store catalog efficiently.

item.name: Products
item.description:
### Product Management

- **Public Access:** Browse all available products, search by name, and view detailed information.
    
- **Admin Access:** Full administrative authority to **Add** new products, **Update** existing item details, or **Delete** products from the inventory.
    
- **Media Handling:** Supports managing product images and category assignments.

item.name: Baskets
item.description:
### Shopping Basket Operations

- **Guest Transactions:** Allows anonymous users to add, update, or remove items from a temporary shopping basket.
    
- **Persistance:** Manages the lifecycle of the user's selected products before proceeding to checkout.
    
- **Validation:** Retrieves current basket state and total counts by unique basket identifiers.

item.name: Payments
item.description:
### Payment Processing

- **Secure Transactions:** Endpoints for creating payment intents and initializing secure checkout sessions.
    
- **Status Verification:** Confirms the success or failure of payments via internal and external verification.
    
- **Method Management:** Access to available payment providers and configurations (e.g., Cards, Wallets).
    
- **Payment History:** Keeps track of transaction IDs and payment logs for security and auditing.

item.name: Orders
item.description:
### Order Management

- **Order History:** Allows authenticated users to view their past and current orders.
    
- **Order Tracking:** Provides real-time status updates (e.g., Pending, Shipped, Delivered) for specific orders.
    
- **Administrative Control:** Enables Admins to monitor all system orders and update their delivery status.
    
- **Details:** Access to full itemized summaries for each transaction.
